social_awareness.description: Social awareness. Subscore used in assigning diagnosis.

social_cognition.description: Social cognition. Subscore used in assigning diagnosis.

social_communication.description: Social communication. Subscore used in assigning diagnosis.

social_motivation.description: Social motivation. Subscore used in assigning diagnosis.

autistic_mannerisms.description: Autistic mannerisms. Subscore used in assigning diagnosis.

total_raw_score.description: Raw score. Subscore used in assigning diagnosis.

total_t_score.description: T score. Subscore used in assigning diagnosis.

Q01.description: Seems much more fidgety in social situations than when alone.

Q02.description: Expressions on his or her face don't match what he or she is saying.

Q03.description: Seems self-confident when interacting with others.

Q04.description: When under stress, he or she shows rigid or inflexible patterns of behavior that seem odd.

Q05.description: Doesn't recognize when others are trying to take advantage of him or her.

Q06.description: Would rather be alone than with others.

Q07.description: Is aware of what others are thinking or feeling.

Q08.description: Behaves in ways that seem strange or bizarre.

Q09.description: Clings to adults, seems too dependent on them.

Q10.description: Takes things too literally and doesn't get the real meaning of a conversation.

Q12.description: Is able to communicate his or her feelins to others.

Q13.description: Is akward in turn-taking interactions with peers.

Q15.description: Is able to understand the meaning of other people's tone of voice and facial expressions.

Q16.description: Avoids eye contact or has unusual eye contact.

Q18.description: Has difficulty making friends, even when trying his or her best.

Q19.description: Gets frustrated trying to get ideas across in conversations.

Q20.description: Shows unusual sensory interests or strange ways of playing with toys.

Q21.description: Is able to imitate others' actions.

Q22.description: Plays appropriately with children his or her age.

Q23.description: Does not join group activities unless told to do so.

Q24.description: Has more difficulty than other children with changes in his or her routine.

Q25.description: Doesn't seem to mind being out of step with others.

Q26.description: Offers comfort to others when they are sad.

Q27.description: Avoids starting social interactions with peers or adults.

Q28.description: Thinks or talks about the same thing over and over.

Q29.description: Is regarded by other children as odd or weird.

Q30.description: Becomes upset in a sitaution with lots of things going on.

Q31.description: Can't get his or her mind off somethign once he or she starts thinking about it.

Q33.description: Is socially awkward, even when he or she is trying to be polite.

Q34.description: Avoids people who want to be emotionally close to him or her.

Q35.description: Has trouble keeping up with the flow of a normal conversation.

Q38.description: Responds appropriately to mood changes in others.

Q39.description: Has an unusually narrow range of interests.

Q41.description: Wanders aimlessly from one activity to another.

Q42.description: Seems overly sensitive to sounds, textures, or smells.

Q44.description: Doesn't understand how events relate to one another.

Q45.description: Focuses his or her attention to where others are looking or listening.

Q47.description: Is too silly or laughs inappropriately.

Q48.description: Has a sense of humor, understands jokes.

Q49.description: Does extremely well at a few tasks, but does not do as well at most other tasks.

Q50.description: Has repetitive, odd behaviors such as hand flapping or rocking.

Q51.description: Has difficulty answering questions directly and ends up talking around the subject.

Q52.description: Knows when he or she is talking too loud or making too much noise.

Q53.description: Talks to people with an unusual tone of voice.

Q54.description: Seems to react to people as if they are objects.

Q55.description: Knows when he or she is too close to someone or invading someone's space.

Q56.description: Walks in between two people who are talking.

Q58.description: Concentrates too much on parts of things rather than seeing the whole picture.

Q60.description: Is emotionally distant, doesn't show his or her feelings.

Q61.description: Is inflexible, has a hard time changing his or her mind.

Q62.description: Gives unusual or illogical reasons for doing things.

Q63.description: Touches others in an unusual way.

Q64.description: Is too tense in social settings,

Q65.description: Stares or gazes off into space.

ID.description: Secondary diagnosis of ID (ex. fragile X, speech delay, aphasia)

Seizures.description: Secondary diagnosis of seizures (ex. epilepsy, absence seizures, Landau-Kleffner syndrome)

Tourette or Tic Disorder.description: Secondary diagnosis of Tourette or tic disorder

Mood Disorder.description: Secondary diagnosis of mood disorder (ex. depression, bipolar)

Anxiety Disorder.description: Secondary diagnosis of anxiety disorder (ex. OCD, anxiety, pica)

Autoimmune/Allergic.description: Secondary diagnosis of autoimmune/allergic (ex. asthma, allergies, lactose intolerant)

Behavior.description: Secondary diagnosis of behavior (ex. ADD, ADHD, ODD)

diagnosis.description: Overall diagnosis calculated from combination of instruments.

clinical_diagnosis.description: Diagnosis given by clinician. Coded value.

clinical_diagnosis_raw.description: Original diagnosis given by clinician. Free text.

cpea_diagnosis.description: CPEA diagnosis - combines ADIR and ADOS.

cpea_adjusted_diagnosis.description: CPEA diagnosis - combines ADIR and ADOS. This diagnosis is adjusted to mark true controls (where both ADOS and ADIR agree that this is a control) from Suspected Control (where ADOS and ADIR disagree).
